title: WhatsApp → n8n → Home Assistant
description: Bi-directional automation pipeline: command parsing, workflow routing, and Home Assistant service execution via WhatsApp messages.
whatILearned: Designing robust bidirectional message flows between cloud messaging and a local automation stack.
Handling WhatsApp Cloud verification, retries, and webhook edge cases.
Structuring n8n workflows to stay maintainable as commands and integrations expand.
bestFor: Home Assistant users who want remote command/control via WhatsApp without exposing HA directly to the internet.

featureToggle.reason: Core automation backbone that other experiments can reuse.

futurePlans: Add templated flows for common Home Assistant routines (lights, climate, media).
Add basic per-user access control and command scoping.
Add a simple configuration layer for commands and aliases.
Optionally integrate a commercial weather API as a data source.
statusForContributors: Accepting PRs focused on reliability, config UX, and example flows.

changelog.note: Stability improvements; expanded logging around webhook/command parsing.

title: Meta Smart Glasses WhatsApp Relay (Blocked)
description: Experiment to surface WhatsApp-driven notifications on Meta display glasses; stalled due to platform delivery/notification constraints for business/developer chats.
whatILearned: Mapping real-world platform constraints: which WhatsApp message types/accounts propagate to glasses vs phone only.
Designing low-friction notification relays using existing automation tooling.
Identifying the boundary where lack of official APIs prevents reliable HUD-style delivery.
bestFor: Developers testing the limits of Meta glasses notification delivery using WhatsApp as a relay channel.

featureToggle.reason: Interesting concept, currently blocked by platform behavior and lack of exposed APIs.

futurePlans: Revisit if Meta exposes better notification/companion APIs or changes delivery rules.
Extract reusable relay patterns back into the WhatsApp automation project.
Document constraints and reproducible tests so others can validate changes over time.
statusForContributors: Ideas welcome; work is blocked pending platform changes.

changelog.note: Paused: reliable delivery to glasses not achievable with current constraints.

title: Movie/Series Tracker — Android
description: Native Android movie/series tracker using TMDb search, local caching, and Room-backed multi-page settings.
whatILearned: Designing an offline-friendly media tracker with API-backed search and local persistence.
Porting a Qt/C++ data model and workflows to Kotlin/Room cleanly (entities, relations, converters).
Managing TMDb limits and caching strategies to keep UI responsive.
bestFor: Android users who want a customizable, local-first way to track movies and series using TMDb.

featureToggle.reason: Polished mobile build; demonstrates Room + network + settings complexity.

futurePlans: Add sync between Android and Linux via export/import or optional cloud backend.
Add per-profile watchlists and simple stats (time watched, genres, trends).
Polish theming and optionally adopt Material You alignment.
statusForContributors: Accepting PRs for UI polish, sync options, and filtering features.

changelog.note: Near completion: series support, settings persistence, performance tuning.

title: Movie/Series Tracker — Linux (Qt)
description: Qt/QML desktop movie+series tracker using TMDb search and a local SQLite-backed library.
whatILearned: Building a desktop-first library workflow with Qt/QML and SQLite.
Structuring TMDb-backed search and caching for a keyboard-and-mouse power-user flow.
Keeping architecture concepts portable so Android could mirror the core model.
bestFor: Linux desktop users who want a Qt-based movie/series tracker integrated into a desktop workflow.

featureToggle.reason: Desktop companion showcasing Qt/QML and local DB design.

futurePlans: Improve power-user features for fast navigation and bulk edits.
Optional integration with local media libraries/players.
Align UX patterns with Android for cross-device consistency.
statusForContributors: Accepting PRs for UI refinement, performance, and advanced features.

title: Analog Lofi Linux Clock Plasmoid
description: KDE Plasma analog clock plasmoid inspired by a Windows-era widget aesthetic.
whatILearned: Porting a nostalgic widget aesthetic into a modern Plasma 6 plasmoid.
Handling config persistence, resizing/aspect behavior, and repaint timing.
Hardening QML UI against Plasma/Qt version differences.
bestFor: KDE Plasma users who want retro-style desktop widgets with low overhead.

featureToggle.reason: Shippable plasmoid that demonstrates Plasma 6 support and polish.

futurePlans: Add optional theme variants (skins/colors).
Expose advanced config without cluttering defaults.
Package for easy installation via KDE ecosystem.
statusForContributors: Looking for Plasma 6 testers; PRs for themes/translations welcome.

changelog.note: v1.1: Plasma 6 update; config handling corrected; tooltip fixes; adaptive repaint timing; aspect-ratio resizing stabilized; deprecated code removed.

title: Linux Penny Arcade Comic Displayer
description: KDE Plasma widget that fetches and displays the latest Penny Arcade comic with graceful offline behavior.
whatILearned: Building a network-fed plasmoid that fails gracefully under unreliable connectivity.
Optimizing layout for panel vs desktop widget sizes.
Adding caching and update pacing to avoid excessive fetches.
bestFor: KDE Plasma users who want a webcomic widget integrated into their desktop.

featureToggle.reason: Stable niche widget; good demonstration of content fetching patterns.

futurePlans: Support additional comics via presets/config.
Add archive navigation.
Improve caching controls and error UX.
statusForContributors: Looking for Plasma 6 testers; PRs for additional sources welcome.

title: Conky Halloween Clock
description: Seasonal Conky digital clock theme for a Halloween desktop overlay.
whatILearned: Designing readable themed overlays with constrained layout tools.
Packaging/documenting a small cosmetic project for others to reuse.
bestFor: Linux users who want seasonal desktop flair via Conky.
futurePlans: Add more seasonal variants (winter/spring/neutral).
Provide presets for common desktop configs.
statusForContributors: PRs welcome for themes and presets.

title: Android Subscription Tracker
description: Local-first Android app to track subscriptions with category filtering, icon selection, and WorkManager reminders that advance billing dates.
whatILearned: Designing Room models with type converters and safe schema evolution.
Using WorkManager for one-shot work + explicit rescheduling without duplicate execution.
Separating UI-triggered scheduling from worker-triggered state updates to avoid race conditions.
bestFor: Android users who want local subscription tracking without cloud dependencies (once reminder logic is restored).

featureToggle.reason: Good architecture demo, but currently stalled due to reminder reliability regressions.

futurePlans: Restore reminder reliability (single notification + persisted next billing date update).
Add analytics views (monthly totals, category breakdown).
Support custom reminder offsets (e.g., 3 days before).
Add JSON export/import.
statusForContributors: If a public repo is added, contributions would focus on reminders, tests, and edge-case handling.

changelog.note: Reminder behavior unstable again after changes; app marked stalled.
Icon picker and category filtering implemented.
